commit_message:
Identify not allowed parameters in upgrades.

This change allows us identifying a set of parameters which should
not been passed in the upgrade prepare or upgrade converge steps.
As it is now, it is mostly intended to block the converge step
if the FFU parameters (Stein registry parameters)  were left in
the environment files before running the converge step, however
it will allow blocking the upgrade prepare in the case that some
deprecated or not recommended parameter is provided in the templates.

The way how it works is by converting every single yaml passed in
the environment files into a  list of keys (only for the
parameters_default so far), then it will try to intersect the list
of forbidden parameters with the list of keys. If there is a match
an exception will be raised showing those parameters:

ERROR openstack [-] The following parameters should be removed from
the environment files:
ceph3_namespace
name_suffix_stein
tag_stein
name_prefix_stein
ceph3_image
namespace_stein
ceph3_tag

Change-Id: I24715f5e55d4cd6cf9879345980d3a3c5ab8830c
(cherry picked from commit fbc1eba88aa41d4a2ee73ebd4af3c212a4459829)
(cherry picked from commit 3a86f9f7f54c68e1099b08d9a6b7ac1cc9eaaaa6)

* Changed the node_template type more general in example of VNFD'}, {'account_id': 27880, 'date': '2020-06-24 01:43:43.000000000', 'content': 'Topic changed from bp/cnf-support-with-etsi-nfv-specs-1 to bp/cnf-support-with-etsi-nfv-specs'}, {'account_id': 22290, 'date': '2020-06-25 06:34:43.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

(2 comments)'}, {'account_id': 27880, 'date': '2020-07-01 01:31:03.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5:

> VNFD checking for CNF

When the specs for CNF operation is clearly defined in ETSI, we can decide whether to support CNF operation without VNFD checking, but I now believe that it helps users to maintain their VNF Package in the manner of existing specs. IMO, it's useful to create multiple deployment flavours in a VNF Package to support both of the deployment on pre-isntalled k8s and on new k8s inside VM.

> example of VnfcResourceInfo in InstantiatedVnfInfo

The following is an example for mandatory attributes. This may be needed in terminating operation to find all related k8s resources.

VnfcResourceInfo
> id: random uuid
> vduId: type of k8s resource
> computeResource
>> resourceId: name of k8s resource"}, {'account_id': 22290, 'date': '2020-07-06 10:06:16.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5: Code-Review+1

Thank you for your answer. Let's wait others opinions:)"}, {'account_id': 25701, 'date': '2020-07-06 11:06:34.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 17255, 'date': '2020-07-09 04:10:56.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: Code-Review+1

Sorry for the late, I agree with your reply.'}, {'account_id': 26222, 'date': '2020-07-14 15:31:48.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1

LGTM. It's the useful feature for CNF field."}]

commit_message:
Container Network Function with VNFM and CISM

This specification describes enhancement of
VNF Lifecycle Management for Container Network Function
on pre-installed Kubernetes cluster.

The CNF instantiation/termination
* Load CNF definition files in CSAR artifact
* Extend Kubernetes infra_driver for general APIs

Blueprint: cnf-support-with-etsi-nfv-specs
Change-Id: Icdf221b6193cee6ad79f030cd86ab8b10d9ffd57

commit_message:
Add template for charm check and gate

Add new template to cover the required range of py3 versions
that the OpenStack Charms need to be validated against.

This is mainly driven by the Ubuntu versions the charms have
to support which includes back to Ubuntu 16.04 LTS (Python 3.5)
and to the current 20.04 LTS (Python 3.8).

Master branch of all charms will be switched to use this
template in time for the next charm release in August 2020.

Stable branches will not be updated however old templates
have been marked as DEPRECATED FOR REMOVAL.

Change-Id: Ib9ed240aef6680be7c972088ca5337b5740b9c36

commit_message:
Remove tempest-integrated-networking job from neutron queue

As we agreed during virtual PTG we want to change
tempest-multinode-full-py3 that it will run only integrated-networking
tests. And then promote it to be voting and gating job.

This new multinode job can replace singlenode tempest-integrated-networking
job so this patch removes this one from the queues too.

Change-Id: Ic61b636625824bbd6b7624a057db308a484ee463

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-07-13 14:38:29.000000000', 'message': 'Functional tests to explicitly use ML2/OVS

The Neutron project is changing DevStack to default to the ML2/OVN
mechanism driver by default [0] but, a handful of functinal tests
for openstacksdk is not backend agnostic (see the Story linked with this
patch) and needs to be adapted or skipped when running with ML2/OVN. As
a first step, just to unblock the DevStack gate this patch is explicitly
configuring the functional tests to run against ML2/OVS.

[0] ML2/OVS is and will be still full supported by the community.

Change-Id: I374b03130310e17b01d2b992eebe70658617e297
Story: 2007919
Signed-off-by: Lucas Alvares Gomes <lucasagomes@gmail.com>

commit_message:
Functional tests to explicitly use ML2/OVS

The Neutron project is changing DevStack to default to the ML2/OVN
mechanism driver by default [0] but, a handful of functinal tests
for openstacksdk is not backend agnostic (see the Story linked with this
patch) and needs to be adapted or skipped when running with ML2/OVN. As
a first step, just to unblock the DevStack gate this patch is explicitly
configuring the functional tests to run against ML2/OVS.

[0] ML2/OVS is and will be still full supported by the community.

Change-Id: I374b03130310e17b01d2b992eebe70658617e297
Story: 2007919
Signed-off-by: Lucas Alvares Gomes <lucasagomes@gmail.com>

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-05-20 05:15:54.000000000', 'message': 'Skip VFs configured for DPDKs during NIC ordering

During NIC ordering all the VFs are expected to be skipped.
But if DPDK drivers are bound to a VF, then those VFs are still taken
in to account and is affecting the NIC ordering. The VFs bound to DPDK
drivers also shall be removed from the NIC ordering logic resulting in
consistency even with the re-run of os-net-config.

Change-Id: I50af9f75b01addae0e13830cc7a863072f9be34c
(cherry picked from commit 761b4621b0bb36d2658ca25929b0270e3cfc9c77)
'}]
commit_message:
Skip VFs configured for DPDKs during NIC ordering

During NIC ordering all the VFs are expected to be skipped.
But if DPDK drivers are bound to a VF, then those VFs are still taken
in to account and is affecting the NIC ordering. The VFs bound to DPDK
drivers also shall be removed from the NIC ordering logic resulting in
consistency even with the re-run of os-net-config.

Change-Id: I50af9f75b01addae0e13830cc7a863072f9be34c
(cherry picked from commit 761b4621b0bb36d2658ca25929b0270e3cfc9c77)

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-07-13 15:10:15.000000000', 'message': "maintain-github-mirror: add requests dependency

maintain-github-mirror makes direct use of the requests module. That
module is currently installed as a dependency of PyGithub, but that's
brittle, as PyGithub may well opt for a different library in the
future.

Let's proactively fix that before it bites us.

Change-Id: I8fc288e6c3978e20ddf48f905968931f89834e53
"}]
commit_message:
maintain-github-mirror: add requests dependency

maintain-github-mirror makes direct use of the requests module. That
module is currently installed as a dependency of PyGithub, but that's
brittle, as PyGithub may well opt for a different library in the
future.

Let's proactively fix that before it bites us.

Change-Id: I8fc288e6c3978e20ddf48f905968931f89834e53

commit_message:
Enable grenade again for Stein, Rocky and Queens

Devstack and Tempest jobs were recently fixed for Rocky, Queens and
Pike, now we can restore the grenade testing of Stein, Rocky and
Queens respectively.

Change-Id: Ic7147170da6fb7f9f86022658a767e058b022ffb

commit_message:
Switch openshift deployment to use cri-o

Use the CRI-O container engine instead of Docker for OpenShift as the
docker binary may not be available on RHEL8-based images.

https://docs.openshift.com/container-platform/3.11/crio/crio_runtime.html

Change-Id: I2fed559a64c73ef1e98b681878d488ea055bcf90

[{'created': '2020-06-04 12:46:47.000000000', 'message': "Add allocation-pool support for the public_net

TripleO CI uses 10.0.0.1 statically for the undercloud's
public interface. When using extra node in some job's
there is sometime a conflict, because the extra node get's
the 10.0.0.1 address allocated.

Adding support to define the allocation pools on the
public_net allows TripleO CI to define a pool with the
10.0.0.1 address eliminated.

A good practice would be to set up OVB to use
[{start: 10.0.0.128, end: 10.0.0.253}], and then configure
the undercloud/overcloud deployed on the OVB infrastructure
to use addresses in the range 10.0.0.1-10.0.0.127.

The parameter public_net_allocation_pools controls the
allocation pool setting, by default all addresses of the
subnet is in the pool.

Related-Bug: #1874418

commit_message:
Add allocation-pool support for the public_net

TripleO CI uses 10.0.0.1 statically for the undercloud's
public interface. When using extra node in some job's
there is sometime a conflict, because the extra node get's
the 10.0.0.1 address allocated.

Adding support to define the allocation pools on the
public_net allows TripleO CI to define a pool with the
10.0.0.1 address eliminated.

A good practice would be to set up OVB to use
[{start: 10.0.0.128, end: 10.0.0.253}], and then configure
the undercloud/overcloud deployed on the OVB infrastructure
to use addresses in the range 10.0.0.1-10.0.0.127.

The parameter public_net_allocation_pools controls the
allocation pool setting, by default all addresses of the
subnet is in the pool.

Related-Bug: #1874418
Change-Id: Ieca4864e069148abb49eb709bf7f48a14ef04e77

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-07-14 10:06:28.000000000', 'message': 'Fix RUN_ANSWER unbount variable issue

Since merging Ibb0676e7a3d97645e4e8a2553e7ec175e96a14b4
"Add --yes into update commands to autoconfirm." into stable/train
my FFU attempts are failing with:
/home/stack/overcloud_system_upgrade-controller-0.sh: line 11: RUN_ANSWER: unbound variable

Reason for this is that RUN_ANSWER gets set only inside the if ceph_osd_enabled
branch, which in my case is false. Let's move setting that variable
outside the if so it gets set everytime.

This script seems to be the only one where it was inadvertently left
inside the if.

Change-Id: I35df29521c1807113710d7d6cc039551400ebe2f
'}]
commit_message:
Fix RUN_ANSWER unbount variable issue

Since merging Ibb0676e7a3d97645e4e8a2553e7ec175e96a14b4
"Add --yes into update commands to autoconfirm." into stable/train
my FFU attempts are failing with:
/home/stack/overcloud_system_upgrade-controller-0.sh: line 11: RUN_ANSWER: unbound variable

Reason for this is that RUN_ANSWER gets set only inside the if ceph_osd_enabled
branch, which in my case is false. Let's move setting that variable
outside the if so it gets set everytime.

This script seems to be the only one where it was inadvertently left
inside the if.

Change-Id: I35df29521c1807113710d7d6cc039551400ebe2f

commit_message:
Add version dropdown on docs.starlingx.io

This patch adds the version dropdown from the openstackdocstheme to the
starlingxdocstheme. Change will allow users to view different versions
of StarlingX documentation.

Change-Id: I44b797e00be065e36cb3e7b447c83f8ab5fd69b5
Signed-off-by: MCamp859 <maryx.camp@intel.com>

commit_message:
tripleo_container_manage: only run exec/create playbooks when needed

Only run these playbooks when there are some containers to manage with

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-07-02 13:59:12.000000000', 'message': 'Enable passing of integer value for pool-set action

Enable passing of an integer to the pool-set function.  Due to how juju
appears to parse things on the command line, setting type to string
causes it to fail to accept '3', "3" or 3 as a string.  Only "'3'"
works.  However, if we remove the type from actions.yaml and do the
validation in the charm, any value can be passed.

Depends-On: I6081c23af61fd5e872982ff477b0a5cb27141d11

Change-Id: Idf3468d9ae28dafc09c86f08b7f8c6470a665b7a
Closes-Bug: #1838650
'}]
commit_message:
Enable passing of integer value for pool-set action

Enable passing of an integer to the pool-set function.  Due to how juju
appears to parse things on the command line, setting type to string
causes it to fail to accept '3', "3" or 3 as a string.  Only "'3'"
works.  However, if we remove the type from actions.yaml and do the
validation in the charm, any value can be passed.

Depends-On: I6081c23af61fd5e872982ff477b0a5cb27141d11

Change-Id: Idf3468d9ae28dafc09c86f08b7f8c6470a665b7a
Closes-Bug: #1838650

commit_message:
Reuse database connections.

This PR should only speed up charm hook execution be reusing database
connections. Tested with ~35 client units connected to the shared-db
relation and execution time of db_router_respond dripped from >5mins
to ~1min.

Tested with https://github.com/juju/charm-helpers/pull/478

Change-Id: I9cb4937207fcd0b8045b8b67f63c5e9397decfb4

messages:
[{'account_id': 4393, 'date': '2020-06-25 20:33:18.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 4393, 'date': '2020-06-25 20:38:14.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Pretend we have a fine-grained method of granting the user to get past my new authorization check. This would pass an admin-enabled ImageRepo to copy-image tasks, and the ImportActionWrapper class would use it to do things like setting the image properties only. Right now, only get_flow() uses this, which is pointless, but it shows that we do that first operation as admin, which is what I was choking on, and what the test I added in HEAD~3 was hitting.'}, {'account_id': 4393, 'date': '2020-06-26 02:44:18.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Haven't fixed up the functional tests yet, obviously.

If this seems like a reasonable approach, I'll fill this out, and work on enabling it to actually work by adding the policy knobs."}, {'account_id': 9303, 'date': '2020-06-26 07:42:31.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

I know this is PoC, Wrapper concept looks fine to me.

Just to note that when I tried this to create image using import in all-stores I saw below behavior.

1. When operation starts os_glance_importing_to_stores doesn't show first store and starts with ',store2,store3,..'
2. When import workflow starts image state never changes to importing
3. After completion of importing image to one store it gets deducted from os_glance_importing_to_stores and appended to os_glance_failed_import (I know this is ToDo, but just wants to highlight)
4. After successful completion of operation, Image remains in uploading state only (I guess that is because we are not passing state to save in wrapper)"}, {'account_id': 4393, 'date': '2020-06-26 13:29:56.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

> I know this is PoC, Wrapper concept looks fine to me.
 > 
 > Just to note that when I tried this to create image using import in
 > all-stores I saw below behavior.
 > 
 > 1. When operation starts os_glance_importing_to_stores doesn't show
 > first store and starts with ',store2,store3,..'
 > 2. When import workflow starts image state never changes to
 > importing
 > 3. After completion of importing image to one store it gets
 > deducted from os_glance_importing_to_stores and appended to
 > os_glance_failed_import (I know this is ToDo, but just wants to
 > highlight)
 > 4. After successful completion of operation, Image remains in
 > uploading state only (I guess that is because we are not passing
 > state to save in wrapper)

I literally haven't even done that, so I'm not surprised it's unhelpful. All I did was write enough of this to get past the forbidden check in the test I added before this. Not surprised that it has issues like the format of the string :)

I'd like to get a read from jokke too, and anyone else you think is important to sign-off on the idea, after which time I'll really work on making this work-work."}, {'account_id': 11904, 'date': '2020-06-29 17:57:04.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

This looks like a good approach.'}, {'account_id': 5314, 'date': '2020-06-30 14:59:22.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-06-25 20:33:18.000000000', 'message': 'WIP: Admin import action wrapper

This is a PoC of my proposed way to encapsulate admin metadata
manipulation for copy-image imports.

Change-Id: Iac75956e314ec6f41db18430486bd8be9754e780
'}, {'created': '2020-06-30 17:10:47.000000000', 'message': 'WIP: Admin import action wrapper

This is a PoC of my proposed way to encapsulate admin metadata
manipulation for copy-image imports.

Change-Id: Iac75956e314ec6f41db18430486bd8be9754e780
'}, {'created': '2020-06-30 21:44:47.000000000', 'message': 'Make import task capable of running as admin on behalf of user

This makes the api_image_import task capable of running as an admin on
behalf of a user if so authorized by the API. It includes a new object
called ImportActionWrapper which provides a bundle of utility methods
which can be run either against the user-authorized or admin-authorized
ImageRepo passed in from the API. It encapsulates all the actions
we are able and willing to run as an admin for the user.

This is currently not drivable by the API because the policy check is
still statically defined as "admin or owner" but this change is
offered without any needed modification to the functional tests to
prove that it does not regress existing functionality. The following
patch will introduce a more robust knob for allowing users to do this,
and it brings the functional test changes with it.

Change-Id: Iac75956e314ec6f41db18430486bd8be9754e780
'}, {'created': '2020-07-01 15:41:55.000000000', 'message': 'Make import task capable of running as admin on behalf of user

commit_message:
Make import task capable of running as admin on behalf of user

This makes the api_image_import task capable of running as an admin on
behalf of a user if so authorized by the API. It includes a new object
called ImportActionWrapper which provides a bundle of utility methods
which can be run either against the user-authorized or admin-authorized
ImageRepo passed in from the API. It encapsulates all the actions
we are able and willing to run as an admin for the user.

This is currently not drivable by the API because the policy check is
still statically defined as "admin or owner" but this change is
offered without any needed modification to the functional tests to
prove that it does not regress existing functionality. The following
patch will introduce a more robust knob for allowing users to do this,
and it brings the functional test changes with it.

Change-Id: Iac75956e314ec6f41db18430486bd8be9754e780

commit_message:
Add context.elevated() helper for getting admin privileges

This adds an elevated() method to glance.context.RequestContext similar
to what Nova and other projects use. When doing something as admin on
behalf of a user, this results in a whole context, including information
about the user and the request, but with is_admin==True.

Change-Id: I5499946425b1c32476c57241b4b14b601daa841f

The ioctl request 'BLOCKSIZE64' returns the size of the

under Linux source tree.

commit_message:
Set default block.db size based on osd device size

Default value of block.db (bluestore_block_db_size) is set
to 1024. However, this may end up being lower than the
recommended size of 4%. This change sets the block.db size
as the 4% of the osd device size.

In case, the size of the disk(s) can't be retrieved e.g.
I/O error or it's less than 1G, it's set to 1G as that's
the previous default.

Partial-Bug: #1827463

Change-Id: I6a86b3c51344e5b5791aa066c07db7a78c9fe375

commit_message:
add "verify_ssl_path" config for barbican key manager

Now we cann't use the verify_ssl if we set True, so we
add the "verify_ssl_path" config to solve it.

Closes-Bug: #1876102
(cherry picked from commit 89f311dfbd264a5d4309ea1ca4283f2746d6fa24)

Change-Id: I83bafe5b7e0c4cca67f773858007fb59d98a93a5

this PR is somewhat related: https://review.opendev.org/#/c/677649/'}, {'account_id': 10206, 'date': '2019-09-18 10:47:44.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: -Code-Review

I am trying to fix this patch and I am not clear about the final discussion. To summarize:

1: Don't allow deleting ports with vifs even in maintenance mode.
2: Ironic deletes the vifs first(or users deletes the neutron port first) and then deletes the port in Ironic.
3: Raise a new error "node in transition" if the port has cleaning, rescuing or provisioning ports attached to it. And the exisiting error will be raised only when tenant vif is attached.

Please let me know if this is what we intend to do. I will revise the patch accordingly.'}, {'account_id': 10206, 'date': '2019-09-19 07:32:18.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 10206, 'date': '2019-09-19 07:35:15.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

Hi All,
I have updated the code to include a few more cases:

* Allow port deletion only when no VIF is attached
  to it be the node in maintenance or not.
* Block port deletion if VIF is attached to it, be
  the node in maintenance or not.
* Port deletion now doesn't depend on node being active
  or in maintenance mode

Please note that I haven't updated the test yet, will update after the code is finalized. Thanks!"}, {'account_id': 19339, 'date': '2019-09-19 11:12:21.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

Build failed. For 3rd party CI contact info: https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/ThirdPartySystems

Based on Mark's comments, I think we ought to change this; it isn't correct to always check if there is a VIF associated with the tenant, because it might not be the port that is bound."}, {'account_id': 14826, 'date': '2020-01-09 16:01:06.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 8:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 6618, 'date': '2020-01-09 17:14:54.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 8:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 11655, 'date': '2020-02-07 00:52:42.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 8:

> (1 comment)
 > 
 > Based on Mark's comments, I think we ought to change this; it isn't
 > correct to always check if there is a VIF associated with the
 > tenant, because it might not be the port that is bound.

The original idea was to prevent situations where an ironic api user could orphan a vif attachment record with-in ironic by deleting the port. First tenant ports only, then that expanded to any port through review scope creep.

I'm not sure there is a happy path, but we surely need to consider all states, because an orphaned port means an administrator needs to identify it in neutron and delete it, and there is no way around that.

Maybe inspiration will hit with a clear mind."}, {'account_id': 11655, 'date': '2020-03-12 00:04:31.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 9.'}, {'account_id': 11655, 'date': '2020-03-12 03:18:12.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 9:

(6 comments)

> (4 comments)
 > 
 > Thanks Julia. I've got some suggestions. I'm tempted to approve it
 > but I wanted to mention this because I think it might be wrong.
 > When I reviewed it before, I remarked on how much simpler it was
 > than earlier versions -- which made me think about why, and I
 > realized that the reason it had been done via the node's
 > driver.network is because the implementation/information in the
 > port's internal_info is specific to a type of network driver. I
 > thought I had added a comment about this but I guess I forgot :-( I
 > suppose we could say that it isn't specific and that this is the
 > assumption of what is in the port's internal_info... ?

To respond to the comment in irc, it is a mix of hedging our bets in that we provide a standard vif record interface and we need to prevent silly human mistakes, regardless if there is actually a port attached. Yes, that means someone could change the network interface, and prevent the actual record removal from neutron, but we can't guard against all cases. I guess in a sense, we can't prevent all human mistakes, just the major ones :)

Anyway, I'm good with the simplicity and feel like I over-engineered the first versions."}, {'account_id': 6618, 'date': '2020-04-20 14:44:12.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 12: Code-Review+2

(1 comment)

commit_message:
Block port deletions where vif is present

We must not allow users to be able to delete
ports when a VIF record is present. If they are
able to, then the user risks orphaning ports in
neutron which could result in address depletion
prevent the port from being able to be used again.

Co-Authored-By: Madhuri Kumari <madhuri.kumari@intel.com>
Story: 2006710
Task: 37074
Change-Id: I9f8eaf94a375984ea2f567f0a87c2ed1ed5cb3b7

commit_message:
Add a hacking check for importing mock library

We should only be using unittest.mock since we're python3-only,
so add and enable a hacking check that will catch it.

Change-Id: I64847f329ee3e1a3377a8c63df90c697d8b74c86

commit_message:
Improve README

This improvement is part of a wave of polish
in preparation for the launch of the Ceph product.

In config.yaml, modernise example values for 'source'
and use consistent words with the ceph-osd, ceph-mon,
and ceph-fs charms. Also improve description for
'expected-osd-count'.

Change-Id: Ieaf3b9c2700bcf72ebb34b159cf5c9b761b1514d

commit_message:
Revert "New parameters in order to set how we want to redirect logs"

This reverts commit 80106333b0221b9cc4ee361e616fd0efb1380170.

This incorrectly breaks the output so the 2>&1 is on a
separate line which eats failures.

Change-Id: I70aa6775ce6795e8302523079a0db7933aa87693

[{'created': '2020-07-07 11:09:30.000000000', 'message': 'Add support for authfile in buildcontainers role

When push_containers is set to true, then authfile is needed only
when buildah or podman login has not done previously. The authfile
can be generated using sudo buildah login -u and -p, it defaults
generates the authfile in /run/containers/0/auth.json and
can be passed via --authfile [1] with
openstack tripleo container image build command

authfile path can be setted by setting
buildcontainers_authfile_path var while running build containers
role.

It will be used while pushing container to registry using new
container workflow.

Change-Id: I425a2f4565e870633df87b6c5624fb998bcf09cc
Signed-off-by: Chandan Kumar (raukadah) <chkumar@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Add support for authfile in buildcontainers role

When push_containers is set to true, then authfile is needed only
when buildah or podman login has not done previously. The authfile
can be generated using sudo buildah login -u and -p --authfile
<dir path>, The custom generated authfile can be passed via
--authfile [1] with
openstack tripleo container image build command

authfile path can be setted by set using the
buildcontainers_authfile_path var in build containers role.

It will be used while pushing container to registry using new
container workflow.

[1.] https://docs.openstack.org/project-deploy-guide/tripleo-docs/latest/deployment/3rd_party.html#building-new-containers-with-tripleo-container-image-build

Change-Id: I425a2f4565e870633df87b6c5624fb998bcf09cc
Signed-off-by: Chandan Kumar (raukadah) <chkumar@redhat.com>

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-07-06 14:17:27.000000000', 'message': 'Collapse host prep tasks

Since plays cannot be parallelized with a free-like strategy, we should
have a single play that runs all host prep tasks rather than blocks of
plays for each defined role. By switching to this method we have a
single play that handles the host prep tasks concept that can be run all
at once across a cloud.

Change-Id: I2670840c9beac06f8b8ffc6eaecc88b9119ad298
(cherry picked from commit 3ef8f6008d41a88642d66a6a24c67210f773f87e)
'}, {'created': '2020-07-06 19:18:15.000000000', 'message': 'Collapse host prep tasks

commit_message:
Collapse host prep tasks

Since plays cannot be parallelized with a free-like strategy, we should
have a single play that runs all host prep tasks rather than blocks of
plays for each defined role. By switching to this method we have a
single play that handles the host prep tasks concept that can be run all
at once across a cloud.

Change-Id: I2670840c9beac06f8b8ffc6eaecc88b9119ad298
(cherry picked from commit 3ef8f6008d41a88642d66a6a24c67210f773f87e)

commit_message:
Generate container startup configs with a new module

Remove container_startup_configs_tasks.yaml playbook, and some set_fact
tasks that aren't needed anymore; since we now have a module to generate
container startup config files.

Change-Id: I8ebe7f5f52f14a14c3911748b2e2063e0c3ad9ac

[{'created': '2020-06-25 08:36:26.000000000', 'message': 'Check cherry-pick hashes in pep8 tox target

This adds a tools/ script that checks any cherry-picked hashes
on the current commit (or a provided commit) to make sure that
all the hashes exist on at least master or stable/.* branches.
This should help avoid accidentally merging stable backports
where one of the hashes along the line has changed due to conflicts.

Change-Id: I4afaa0808b75cc31a8dd14663912c162281a1a42
(cherry picked from commit aebc829c4e0d39a160eaaa5ad949c1256c8179e6)
(cherry picked from commit 5cacfaab82853241022d3a2a0734f82dae59a34b)
(cherry picked from commit d307b964ce380f2fa57debc6c4c8346ac8736afe)
'}, {'created': '2020-07-08 15:42:24.000000000', 'message': "Check cherry-pick hashes in pep8 tox target

NOTE(elod.illes): This is a combination of 2 commits: the cherry-pick
hash checker script and a fix for the script.

1. Check cherry-pick hashes in pep8 tox target

This adds a tools/ script that checks any cherry-picked hashes
on the current commit (or a provided commit) to make sure that
all the hashes exist on at least master or stable/.* branches.
This should help avoid accidentally merging stable backports
where one of the hashes along the line has changed due to conflicts.

2. Fix cherry-pick check for merge patch

Cherry-pick check script validates the proposed patch's commit message.
If a patch is not on top of the given branch then Zuul rebases it to
the top and the patch becomes a merge patch. In this case the script
validates the merge patch's commit message instead of the original
patch's commit message and fails.

This fix selects the parent of the patch if it is a merge patch.

(cherry picked from commit c7c48c6f52c9159767b60a4576ba37726156a5f7)
(cherry picked from commit 02f213b831d8e1d4a1d8ebb18d1260571fe20b84)
(cherry picked from commit 7a5111ba2943014b6fd53a5fe7adcd9bc445315e)

Change-Id: I4afaa0808b75cc31a8dd14663912c162281a1a42
(cherry picked from commit aebc829c4e0d39a160eaaa5ad949c1256c8179e6)
(cherry picked from commit 5cacfaab82853241022d3a2a0734f82dae59a34b)
(cherry picked from commit d307b964ce380f2fa57debc6c4c8346ac8736afe)
"}]
commit_message:
Check cherry-pick hashes in pep8 tox target

NOTE(elod.illes): This is a combination of 2 commits: the cherry-pick
hash checker script and a fix for the script.

1. Check cherry-pick hashes in pep8 tox target

This adds a tools/ script that checks any cherry-picked hashes
on the current commit (or a provided commit) to make sure that
all the hashes exist on at least master or stable/.* branches.
This should help avoid accidentally merging stable backports
where one of the hashes along the line has changed due to conflicts.

2. Fix cherry-pick check for merge patch

Cherry-pick check script validates the proposed patch's commit message.
If a patch is not on top of the given branch then Zuul rebases it to
the top and the patch becomes a merge patch. In this case the script
validates the merge patch's commit message instead of the original
patch's commit message and fails.

This fix selects the parent of the patch if it is a merge patch.

(cherry picked from commit c7c48c6f52c9159767b60a4576ba37726156a5f7)
(cherry picked from commit 02f213b831d8e1d4a1d8ebb18d1260571fe20b84)
(cherry picked from commit 7a5111ba2943014b6fd53a5fe7adcd9bc445315e)

Change-Id: I4afaa0808b75cc31a8dd14663912c162281a1a42
(cherry picked from commit aebc829c4e0d39a160eaaa5ad949c1256c8179e6)
(cherry picked from commit 5cacfaab82853241022d3a2a0734f82dae59a34b)

[{'created': '2020-05-22 14:34:20.000000000', 'message': "Civilize logging

Our logs are awful and this commit attempts to fix some issues with
them:
* Make sure we always indicate why some readiness or liveness probe
  fail.
* Supress INFO logs from werkzeug (so that we don't see every probe
  call on INFO level).
* Remove logging of successful probe checks.
* Make watcher restart logs less scary and include more cases.
* Add backoff to watcher restarts so that we don't spam logs when K8s
  API is briefly unavailable.
* Add warnings for low quotas.
* Supress some long logs on K8s healthz failures - we don't need full
  message from K8s printed twice.

I also refactored CNI and controller health probes servers to make sure
they're not duplicating code.

Change-Id: Ia3db4863af8f28cfbaf2317042c8631cc63d9745

commit_message:
Civilize logging

Our logs are awful and this commit attempts to fix some issues with
them:
* Make sure we always indicate why some readiness or liveness probe
  fail.
* Suppress INFO logs from werkzeug (so that we don't see every probe
  call on INFO level).
* Remove logging of successful probe checks.
* Make watcher restart logs less scary and include more cases.
* Add backoff to watcher restarts so that we don't spam logs when K8s
  API is briefly unavailable.
* Add warnings for low quotas.
* Suppress some long logs on K8s healthz failures - we don't need full
  message from K8s printed twice.

I also refactored CNI and controller health probes servers to make sure
they're not duplicating code.

Change-Id: Ia3db4863af8f28cfbaf2317042c8631cc63d9745

commit_message:
3PAR: Fix live migration

After live migrating a volume into the 3PAR driver the volume would be
unusable.  And we would no longer be able to do any operation with it.

Migrated in-use volumes cannot be renamed when migrated and therefore
need to use the "_name_id" field of the Volume object (volumes table in
the DB) to store the original volume's ID so the driver can locate the
volume.

The problem is that, even though the 3PAR driver sets the "_name_id"
field, it doesn't use it for any operation, so once the volume has been
migrated and the ID of the volume no longer matches the one that was
used to create the volume (value now in "_name_id") it will no longer be
able to locate the volume.

This patch adds the logic necessary to locate volumes using the
"_name_id" field.

Closes-Bug: #1697422
Change-Id: I27b9d4be419e1b52db02d4525b292ceeb5d5f867
(cherry picked from commit fc51678298a38dcd94bcfe92c590b38fdb7193e4)
(cherry picked from commit cfde6bd1c0129de86ce123c15742d948624b478f)
Conflicts:
	cinder/tests/unit/volume/drivers/hpe/test_hpe3par.py
	cinder/volume/drivers/hpe/hpe_3par_common.py
	cinder/volume/drivers/hpe/hpe_3par_iscsi.py

commit_message:
Fix Logstash 6 log rotation - Stable/Train

Logstash 6 introduced in Centos 8 in Train release comes with log4j2
configuration that does not remove old compressed logs after rotation
Log rotation config backported from Logstash 7 - Combination of Size
Based and Time Based policies. Deletion occurs after 30 days or
3000 MB log files size - whichever comes first.

Change-Id: Ib44f493aad0813a8aba916c7c353b60cab954b5f
(cherry picked from commit 15f2af1b0217da0a0281268442202f22915570a1)
Closes-Bug: #1886975

commit_message:
Remove fail: tasks

Assume that the operator knows what they are doing. These tasks
are skipped for every service which bumps up the number of tasks
and runtime.

Change-Id: I73f38d6b9cc897537053d810d5cdd61ed74671fb
(cherry picked from commit 492031108ece622eb21621e8e26f1bfb458812a6)

commit_message:
CH Sync for rabbit relation bug fix

Charmhelper sync to pick up the fix to the AMQP context.

amqp relation got dropped since it was removed in commit
9698b5ca2a093a9c8e9e34918357fc0d7b75919d to
charm-glance-simplestreams-sync.

Change-Id: I327eb68a33797c9cd2f6e2edbcff677368708381
Closes-Bug: #1796886
Co-Authored-By: Dmitrii Shcherbakov <dmitrii.shcherbakov@canonical.com>
